column4: Why is it that Complete Removal of a program seems to be completely useless?
which program?
ok the .folders in home
the hidden .folders in home
that is where program user data goes
yeah I just seen, on another distro right now, but  should be the same as Ubuntu for the Banshee stuff,  i'll have a look to see if I can find something hold on
thanks
ok new there was something.  .cache and .config have Banshee stuff in them
if you delete the hidden folder for a program or move it some where else, .mozilla for example, then re open Firefox, it will be like you just installed it for the first time
thanks
most of my issues were in terms of podcasts. It started doubling everything and every podcast would download the Presidents Weekly Address. It was like that RSS feed took over.
oh .gconf  apps has Banshee in it as well
(banshee-1 the exact name, but not really relivaint)  anyway if you remove/move all Banshee stuff from hidden .folders in Home.  and re open Banshee it should be like a new install again
yes it does. Thanks! This is actually easier than Windows which I should have expected. But I live on Banshee and freaked out.
uhmm at the last bit?
what?
nevermind, I misunderstood or something,  I guess you weren't happy when Banshee messed up on you, that's what you were saying basicalley
yeah I had never had a problem with a program in linux since ive been using it. First time I've ever had to deal with it like on Windows.
well as you just learnt, it's easier to fix programs that went wrong in Ubuntu, than on Windows
maybe you moved something about on it, and so something to do with that
or maybe you removed the uhmm.  seperators
This might help
It shouldnt have anything to do with separators. It just expands to the left with blank space, cramming my system monitor towards my global menu. I'll try the commands though.
